page.title: 10British Aerospace-Chadderton
page.content: We visited British Aerospace and were shown round by a retired superintendent called Stanley and Bernard, a research worker. We had a film show and each received books showing the planes Avro's had made in the past. Stanley began in l926 making biplanes with wooden spars and cloth- covered wings. The walls of the canteen had painting of bygone planes. We saw how metal was stretched, bent, machined, pressed and spun. Harry, the metal spinner had made each one of us a bowl. We saw metal being tested to breaking point and dipped in salt baths so it can be shaped without buckling. In the training school a computer controlled lathe made us a chess piece. In one bay, we looked in the body of a plane, called its fuselage and had our picture taken for the Oldham Chronicle.
